H0.text: Who would take silk as part of their job. Judge

H1.text: Who would take silk as part of their job. Lawyer

H2.text: Who would take silk as part of their job. Diplomat

H3.text: Who would take silk as part of their job. Barrister

A4.text: This step referred to as 'being called to the inner bar' or 'taking silk', is considered highly prestigious and has been a step in the career of many New Zealand judges.

A5.text: successful applicants are normally barristers (or, in Scotland, advocates) with at least 10-15 years of experience.

A6.text: King's Counsel in England and Wales have the privilege of sitting within the inner bar of court.
